reporting-org.narrative: International Network for Bamboo and Rattan(INBAR)

title.narrative: SUPPORT TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATIONALISE BAMBOO UNITS

description.narrative: To establish and strengthen bamboo units ; to establish and operationalise national level multi-stakeholder platforms and regional level multi-stakeholder platforms

participating-org.narrative: Ethiopia Environment Forest Climate Change Commission
International Network for Bamboo and Rattan (INBAR)

mailing-address.narrative: East Africa Regional Office INBAR, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

sector.narrative: Bamboo units strengthen the means of implementation in beneficiary countries and coordinate additional resources and forge national and international partnership to propel bamboo development
Bamboo units to strengthen and monitor the implementation of bamboo development in respective countries

title.narrative: Bamboo units and multi-stakeholders platforms establishment
Multi-stake holders workshop organised to prioritise the bamboo development activity in the national programme
Establishment of bamboo units and multi-stakeholders platforms operationalised

comment.narrative: The programme establishment of programme office in three programme beneficiary countries along with full strength of the programme team on the ground. Ethiopia programme office is functioning with INBAR East Africa Regional Office, Kenya programme office is operating in the premises of Kenya Forestry Research Institute (KEFRI) and Uganda programme office is in the premises of National Forestry Authority (NFA). All these offices are functioning with well-equipped furniture and communication facility. The programme teams in three project beneficiary countries are closely working with the INBAR Focal Point for liaising with government authority. The stakeholders group were identified for the establishing the multi-stakeholder platforms. Besides, three bamboo units have been established for knowledge dissemination, implementing bamboo strategic plan and networking and partnership building.

Three bamboo units are functional. Ethiopia bamboo unit is operating in the office premises of EEFCC, Kenya bamboo unit is functional with KEFRI, and Uganda bamboo unit is operational with NFA. Multi-stake holders workshop organised to prioritise the bamboo development activity in the national programme(https://www.inbar.int/stakeholder-workshops-bamboo-development-ethiopia-kenya/)
Three bamboo units are functional. Ethiopia bamboo unit is operating in the office premises of EEFCC, Kenya bamboo unit is functional with KEFRI, and Uganda bamboo unit is operational with NFA.
Three bamboo units established and strengthened; three national level multi-stakeholder platforms and at least six regional level multi-stakeholder platforms established and operationalised.
